author: flobbley
body:
Autodesk

It's not new and it's not super exciting tech or anything, but they're super ingrained into everything Civil Engineering and 3D modeling for design purposes. That and the stock is currently pretty reasonably priced.

author: Paulbo83
body: I use autodesk products every day for work and interned there in college. That is a money making machine right there

author: 0ddb4l1
body:
unfortunately adsk is severely overpriced. I've been a holder since $140 but recently sold out at $288. With that being said, Autodesk isn't going anywhere but up long term.

They have some solid stuff in the works with Autodesk Build and will continue to acquire companies to achieve growth.

I personally like $PCOR and RSTAY/RSTAF

$ADBE $ADSK 🚀

author: babaNK
body: AutoDesk has a shitload of software, not only AutoCad/Inventor

author: HorseLove19
body: Autodesk pretty much dominates the 2D modeling space I think. I used solidworks in school this year and it’s awesome, but applying for civil engineering they really want u to know 2D planning stuff like autocad and revit

author: Ripoldo
body: Software is the worst. Adobe, Autodesk, Microsoft office, I use these a lot and the only major changes they've made in decades are how it looks. I think half their employees must be icon desingers. And now that everything's subscription based they'll probably stop even doing that.

author: rygo796
body:
Computer Aided Engineering, CAE.

Hard to say if there's any particular standouts.  Entire industry with solid growth and \*gasp\* profitability.

PTC, ADSK, ANSS are some of the big ones.  CDNS and SNPS for EDA.

author: Summebride
body: Autodesk is nice, but I always prefer Adobe in that category.  Autodesk is needed by very niche companies and departments.  But Adobe software is needed by basically everyone.  Market is way more broad.

author: lordjonas88
body: Autodesk

author: JonskMusic
body:
Exactly. I don't get it. I mean... photoshop is/was ubiquitous but. its pricey for people. There are people who want to make content and can't afford 50 a month for Premiere etc. Also Adobe has been teasing some really cool AI stuff for years.... but where is it? They haven't really done anything huge in a while.. Creative Cloud is okay.. but its clunky and people don't like paying subscription and they don't like dealing with millions of passwords on an enterprise level etc. Adobe could be great.. but they need to do something big.... although every lawyer on the planet uses Acrobat and calls it Adobe. "Do you have adobe?"... Yet acrobat itself is kind of clunky as well.   


But who is their rival? If you look it up.. None of those companies have much to do with creating content: "Adobe's top competitors include SAP, Salesforce, DocuSign, Dropbox, Getty Images, Shutterstock, Apple, Microsoft, IBM and Autodesk. Adobe is a software company developing digital marketing and media solutions."

author: DontUseEris
body:
Neither is for assemblage. The CAD (assemblage software) is either SolidWorks  or AutoDesk. 

Chegg has the answers to a lot of the questions in the textbooks it also has 24/7 tutoring. 

Wolfram Alpha can answer almost any math question. If you are willing to go pro, I will show you how it got the answer.

author: notbrokemexican
body:
Wrote about this. Autodesk directly lobbies for an infrastructure bill since it benefits from both long term training and subscriptions. Some projects may take much longer than scheduled, resulting in bonus income for orgs like Autodesk.

They have also done interesting things like enter the water business through acquisitions like Innovyze.

https://www.reddit.com/r/wallstreetbets/comments/mjcpfw/understanding_the_infrastructure_bill_the_federal/?utm_medium=android_app&utm_source=share

author: Ensemble_InABox
body:
I love ENPH. Won’t comment on your question but ENPH is the best play in the alternative energy space. Margins are top notch, product road map is top notch, C team are excellent, and the space is growing.

It got super richly valued at the start of the year because people thought climate change was a big priority for Biden.
